intro: Metrosideros polymorpha f. psilophylla, commonly known as the silver-leaf ʻōhā, is a variant of the ʻōhā tree native to Hawaii. It is characterized by its distinctive silvery-white undersides on its leaves, which give it a striking appearance. The plant is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree, typically found in coastal and lowland habitats. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, red or yellowish flowers. This form is part of the Myrtaceae family and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of the Hawaiian Islands.
